018package org.tquadrat.foundation.fx;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.function.BiFunction;
025
026import org.apiguardian.api.API;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.fx.internal.FXUserDataBean;
029import javafx.application.Application;
030import javafx.beans.NamedArg;
031import javafx.scene.Node;
032import javafx.scene.Parent;
033import javafx.scene.Scene;
034import javafx.scene.paint.Paint;
035import javafx.stage.Stage;
036
037/**
038 *  <p>{@summary The user data bean for instances of
039 *  {@link Scene}.}</p>
040 *  <p>A JavaFX {@code Scene} instance allows that arbitrary user data can be
041 *  attached to it, using the method
042 *  {@link Scene#setUserData(Object)}.
043 *  This class provides an extensible container for this kind of data.</p>
044 *  <p>Through the methods</p>
045 *  <ul>
046 *      <li>{@link #setProperty(String, Object) setProperty()}</li>
047 *      <li>{@link #getProperty(String) getProperty()}</li>
048 *      <li>{@link #removeProperty(String) removeProperty()}</li>
049 *      <li>{@link #hasProperty(String) hasProperty()}</li>
050 *  </ul>
051 *  <p>it is already possible to store any type of data into the user data
052 *  bean, but it can be easily extended for additional functionality.</p>
053 *
054 *  <h2>{@code createScene()} Factory Methods</h2>
055 *  <p>The methods</p>
056 *  <ul>
057 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent)}</li>
058 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, Paint)}</li>
059 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, double, double)}</li>
060 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, double, double, Paint)}</li>
061 *      <li>{@link #createScene(SceneUserData, Stage, Parent)}</li>
062 *      <li>{@link #createScene(SceneUserData, Stage, Parent, Paint)}</li>
063 *      <li>{@link #createScene(SceneUserData, Stage, Parent, double, double)}</li>
064 *      <li>{@link #createScene(SceneUserData, Stage, Parent, double, double, Paint)}</li>
065 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, BiFunction)}</li>
066 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, BiFunction, Paint)}</li>
067 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, BiFunction, double, double)}</li>
068 *      <li>{@link #createScene(Application, Stage, Parent, BiFunction, double, double, Paint)}</li>
069 *  </ul>
070 *  <p>can be used to create a
071 *  {@link Scene}
072 *  instance together with the user data. Those methods that do <i>not</i> have
073 *  a {@code supplier} argument will use an instance of {@code SceneUserData}
074 *  (this class); if yu want to use an instance of a derived class, you have to
075 *  implement the respective supplier and use one of the methods that take
076 *  it.</p>
077 *
078 *  @param  <A> The class of the JavaFX application.
079 *
080 *  @version $Id: SceneUserData.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $
081 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
082 *  @UMLGraph.link
083 *  @since 0.1.0
084 */
085@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SceneUserData.java 989 2022-01-13 19:09:58Z tquadrat $" )
086@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
087public non-sealed class SceneUserData<A extends Application> extends FXUserDataBean<A>
088{
089        /*------------*\
090    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
091        \*------------*/
092    /**
093     *  The stage for this scene; this can be the same as the primary stage
094     *  in cases where this scene is that for the application's main window.
095     */
096    private final Stage m_Stage;
097
098        /*--------------*\
099    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
100        \*--------------*/
101    /**
102     *  Creates a new {@code SceneUserData} instance.
103     *
104     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
105     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
106     *      stage.
107     */
108    public SceneUserData( final A application, final Stage primaryStage )
109    {
110        this( application, primaryStage, primaryStage );
111    }   //  SceneUserData()
112
113    /**
114     *  Creates a new {@code SceneUserData} instance.
115     *
116     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
117     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
118     *      stage.
119     *  @param  currentStage    The reference to the stage for this scene.
120     */
121    public SceneUserData( final A application, final Stage primaryStage, final Stage currentStage )
122    {
123        super( application, primaryStage );
124
125        m_Stage = requireNonNullArgument( currentStage, "currentStage" );
126    }   //  SceneUserData()
127
128    /**
129     *  Creates a new {@code SceneUserData} instance and copies the references
130     *  for the application, the primary and the current stage from the given
131     *  user data bean (usually that from the application's main scene).
132     *
133     *  @param  userDataBean    The template user data bean.
134     *  @param  currentStage    The reference to the stage for this scene.
135     */
136    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
137    public SceneUserData( final SceneUserData<? extends A> userDataBean, final Stage currentStage )
138    {
139        this( requireNonNullArgument( userDataBean, "userDataBean" ).getApplication(), userDataBean.getPrimaryStage(), currentStage );
140        userDataBean.getApplicationCSS().ifPresent( this::setApplicationCSS );
141    }   //  SceneUserData()
142
143        /*---------*\
144    ====** Methods **==========================================================
145        \*---------*/
146    /**
147     *  Creates a
148     *  {@link Scene}
149     *  for a specific root
150     *  {@link Node}.
151     *
152     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
153     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
154     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
155     *      stage.
156     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
157     *  @return The new scene instance.
158     */
159    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
160    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root )
161    {
162        final var retValue = createScene( application, primaryStage, root, SceneUserData::new );
163
164        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
165        return retValue;
166    }   //  createScene()
167
168    /**
169     *  Creates a
170     *  {@link Scene}
171     *  for a specific root
172     *  {@link Node}.
173     *
174     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
175     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
176     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
177     *      stage.
178     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
179     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the {@code SceneUserData}
180     *      instance.
181     *  @return The new scene instance.
182     */
183    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
184    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "supplier") final BiFunction<T, ? super Stage, ? extends SceneUserData<T>> supplier )
185    {
186        final var userData = requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).apply( requireNonNullArgument( application, "application" ), requireNonNullArgument( primaryStage, "primaryStage" ) );
187        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ) );
188        primaryStage.setScene( retValue );
189        retValue.setUserData( userData );
190
191        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
192        return retValue;
193    }   //  createScene()
194
195    /**
196     *  Creates a
197     *  {@link Scene}
198     *  for a specific root
199     *  {@link Node}
200     *  with a specific size.
201     *
202     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
203     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
204     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
205     *      stage.
206     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
207     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
208     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
209     *  @return The new scene instance.
210     */
211    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
212    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height )
213    {
214        final var retValue = createScene( application, primaryStage, root, SceneUserData::new, width, height );
215
216        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
217        return retValue;
218    }   //  createScene()
219
220    /**
221     *  Creates a
222     *  {@link Scene}
223     *  for a specific root
224     *  {@link Node}
225     *  with a specific size.
226     *
227     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
228     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
229     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
230     *      stage.
231     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
232     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the {@code SceneUserData}
233     *      instance.
234     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
235     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
236     *  @return The new scene instance.
237     */
238    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
239    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "supplier") final BiFunction<T, ? super Stage, ? extends SceneUserData<T>> supplier, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height )
240    {
241        final var userData = requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).apply( requireNonNullArgument( application, "application" ), requireNonNullArgument( primaryStage, "primaryStage" ) );
242        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), width, height );
243        primaryStage.setScene( retValue );
244        retValue.setUserData( userData );
245
246        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
247        return retValue;
248    }   //  createScene()
249
250    /**
251     *  Creates a
252     *  {@link Scene}
253     *  for a specific root
254     *  {@link Node}
255     *  with a fill.
256     *
257     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
258     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
259     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
260     *      stage.
261     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
262     *  @param  fill    The fill.
263     *  @return The new scene instance.
264     */
265    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
266    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
267    {
268        final var retValue = createScene( application, primaryStage, root, SceneUserData::new, fill );
269
270        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
271        return retValue;
272    }   //  createScene()
273
274    /**
275     *  Creates a
276     *  {@link Scene}
277     *  for a specific root
278     *  {@link Node}
279     *  with a fill.
280     *
281     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
282     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
283     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
284     *      stage.
285     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
286     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the {@code SceneUserData}
287     *      instance.
288     *  @param  fill    The fill.
289     *  @return The new scene instance.
290     */
291    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
292    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "supplier") final BiFunction<T, ? super Stage, ? extends SceneUserData<T>> supplier, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
293    {
294        final var userData = requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).apply( requireNonNullArgument( application, "application" ), requireNonNullArgument( primaryStage, "primaryStage" ) );
295        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), requireNonNullArgument( fill, "fill" ) );
296        primaryStage.setScene( retValue );
297        retValue.setUserData( userData );
298
299        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
300        return retValue;
301    }   //  createScene()
302
303    /**
304     *  Creates a
305     *  {@link Scene}
306     *  for a specific root
307     *  {@link Node}
308     *  with a specific size and fill.
309     *
310     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
311     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
312     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
313     *      stage.
314     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
315     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
316     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
317     *  @param  fill    The fill.
318     *  @return The new scene instance.
319     */
320    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
321    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
322    {
323        final var retValue = createScene( application, primaryStage, root, SceneUserData::new, width, height, fill );
324
325        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
326        return retValue;
327    }   //  createScene()
328
329    /**
330     *  Creates a
331     *  {@link Scene}
332     *  for a specific root
333     *  {@link Node}
334     *  with a specific size and fill.
335     *
336     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
337     *  @param  application The reference for the application's main class.
338     *  @param  primaryStage    The reference for the application's primary
339     *      stage.
340     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
341     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the {@code SceneUserData}
342     *      instance.
343     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
344     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
345     *  @param  fill    The fill.
346     *  @return The new scene instance.
347     */
348    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
349    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "application" ) final T application, @NamedArg( "primaryStage" ) final Stage primaryStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "supplier") final BiFunction<T, ? super Stage, ? extends SceneUserData<T>> supplier, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
350    {
351        final var userData = requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).apply( requireNonNullArgument( application, "application" ), requireNonNullArgument( primaryStage, "primaryStage" ) );
352        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), width, height, requireNonNullArgument( fill, "fill" ) );
353        primaryStage.setScene( retValue );
354        retValue.setUserData( userData );
355
356        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
357        return retValue;
358    }   //  createScene()
359
360    /**
361     *  Creates a
362     *  {@link Scene}
363     *  for a specific root
364     *  {@link Node}.
365     *
366     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
367     *  @param  templateDataBean    The user data from the application's main
368     *      scene.
369     *  @param  currentStage    The stage for the current scene.
370     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
371     *  @return The new scene instance.
372     */
373    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
374    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
375    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "templateDataBean" ) final SceneUserData<T> templateDataBean, @NamedArg( "currentStage" ) final Stage currentStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root )
376    {
377        final var newUserDataBean = new SceneUserData<>( templateDataBean, currentStage );
378        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ) );
379        currentStage.setScene( retValue );
380        retValue.setUserData( newUserDataBean );
381        newUserDataBean.getApplicationCSS().ifPresent( u -> retValue.getStylesheets().add( u.toExternalForm() ) );
382
383        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
384        return retValue;
385    }   //  createScene()
386
387    /**
388     *  Creates a
389     *  {@link Scene}
390     *  for a specific root
391     *  {@link Node}
392     *  with a specific size.
393     *
394     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
395     *  @param  templateDataBean    The user data from the application's main
396     *      scene.
397     *  @param  currentStage    The stage for the current scene.
398     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
399     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
400     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
401     *  @return The new scene instance.
402     */
403    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
404    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
405    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "templateDataBean" ) final SceneUserData<T> templateDataBean, @NamedArg( "currentStage" ) final Stage currentStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height )
406    {
407        final var newUserDataBean = new SceneUserData<>( templateDataBean, currentStage );
408        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), width, height );
409        currentStage.setScene( retValue );
410        retValue.setUserData( newUserDataBean );
411        newUserDataBean.getApplicationCSS().ifPresent( u -> retValue.getStylesheets().add( u.toExternalForm() ) );
412
413        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
414        return retValue;
415    }   //  createScene()
416
417    /**
418     *  Creates a
419     *  {@link Scene}
420     *  for a specific root
421     *  {@link Node}
422     *  with a fill.
423     *
424     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
425     *  @param  templateDataBean    The user data from the application's main scene.
426     *  @param  currentStage    The stage for the current scene.
427     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
428     *  @param  fill    The fill.
429     *  @return The new scene instance.
430     */
431    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
432    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
433    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "templateDataBean" ) final SceneUserData<T> templateDataBean, @NamedArg( "currentStage" ) final Stage currentStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
434    {
435        final var newUserDataBean = new SceneUserData<>( templateDataBean, currentStage );
436        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), requireNonNullArgument( fill, "fill" ) );
437        currentStage.setScene( retValue );
438        retValue.setUserData( newUserDataBean );
439        newUserDataBean.getApplicationCSS().ifPresent( u -> retValue.getStylesheets().add( u.toExternalForm() ) );
440
441        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
442        return retValue;
443    }   //  createScene()
444
445    /**
446     *  Creates a
447     *  {@link Scene}
448     *  for a specific root
449     *  {@link Node}
450     *  with a specific size and fill.
451     *
452     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
453     *  @param  templateDataBean    The user data from the application's main scene.
454     *  @param  currentStage    The stage for the current scene.
455     *  @param  root    The root node of the scene graph.
456     *  @param  width   The width of the scene.
457     *  @param  height  The height of the scene.
458     *  @param  fill    The fill.
459     *  @return The new scene instance.
460     */
461    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
462    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
463    public static final <T extends Application> Scene createScene( @NamedArg( "templateDataBean" ) final SceneUserData<T> templateDataBean, @NamedArg( "currentStage" ) final Stage currentStage, @NamedArg( "root" ) final Parent root, @NamedArg( "width" ) final double width, @NamedArg( "height" ) final double height, @NamedArg( value = "fill", defaultValue = "WHITE" ) final Paint fill )
464    {
465        final var newUserDataBean = new SceneUserData<>( templateDataBean, currentStage );
466        final var retValue = new Scene( requireNonNullArgument( root, "root" ), width, height, requireNonNullArgument( fill, "fill" ) );
467        currentStage.setScene( retValue );
468        retValue.setUserData( newUserDataBean );
469        newUserDataBean.getApplicationCSS().ifPresent( u -> retValue.getStylesheets().add( u.toExternalForm() ) );
470
471        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
472        return retValue;
473    }   //  createScene()
474
475    /**
476     *  Returns the stage for the current scene. If the current scene is the
477     *  application's main scene, the returned stage is the primary stage, so
478     *  that in this case
479     *  {@link #getPrimaryStage()}
480     *  will return the same value as this method.
481     *
482     *  @return The stage for the current scene.
483     */
484    public final Stage getStage() { return m_Stage; }
485
486    /**
487     *  Retrieves the user data from the given instance of
488     *  {@link Scene}.
489     *
490     *  @param  <T> The type of the application's main class.
491     *  @param  scene   The scene.
492     *  @param  applicationClass    The type of the application's main class.
493     *  @return An instance of
494     *      {@link Optional}
495     *      that holds the user data instance.
496     */
497    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
498    public static final <T extends Application> Optional<SceneUserData<T>> retrieveUserData( final Scene scene, final Class<T> applicationClass )
499    {
500        Optional<SceneUserData<T>> retValue = Optional.empty();
501        final var u = requireNonNullArgument( scene, "scene" ).getUserData();
502        if( u instanceof SceneUserData userDataBean )
503        {
504            final var app = userDataBean.getApplication();
505            if( applicationClass.isInstance( app ) )
506            {
507                @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
508                final var data = (SceneUserData<T>) u;
509                retValue = Optional.of( data );
510            }
511        }
512
513        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
514        return retValue;
515    }   //  retrieveUserData()
516}
517//  class SceneUserData
518
519/*
520 *  End of File
521 */
